description: Huge tracts of the Chaco forest are being razed by local Mennonite farmers and Brazilian cattle ranchers amid a surge in the global demand for beef.
title: Land Rush Decimating Remote Chaco Forest in Paraguay
title_page: Land Rush Decimating Remote Chaco Forest in Paraguay - The New York Times
text: A land rush in the Chaco forest of Paraguay, which covers an expanse the size of Poland, is intensifying the upheaval among the areaâ€™s indigenous peoples, who number in the thousands and have been grappling for decades with forays by foreign missionaries and infighting among tribes. One group of hunter-gatherers, the Ayoreo, is under particular stress.
